alert.note: Alert for Colorado; Jackson; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 4:11AM CDT until May 16 at 10:36AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Bedias Creek near Madisonville affecting Madison and Walker Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Boling affecting Brazoria, Fort Bend and Wharton Counties. Sandy Creek near Cordele affecting Wharton, Jackson and Colorado Counties. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. .Additional rainfall is possible over the next few days which could lead to increases in stage levels. For the Bedias Creek...including Madisonville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Boling...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sandy Creek...including Cordele...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sandy Creek near Cordele. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins. Several roads and bridges in the floodplain are flooded and dangerous and livestock in the floodplain are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM CDT Monday was 18.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 07/06/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Sandy Creek Cordele 18.0 18.5 Mon 3 am CDT 17.4 15.0 12.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CDT.
